VEND-CORE-001.text: How does your platform technically enforce the no-storage mandate for wallet transaction data?
What data elements, if any, are transiently processed during verification (e.g., in memory), and what is their maximum retention duration?
Do you maintain any logs, metadata, or derived data from wallet presentations? If so, describe what is logged and retention periods.
How can the organization verify that no transaction content is being stored (e.g., audit mechanisms, architectural diagrams, third-party attestations)?
If your service uses sub-processors or cloud infrastructure, how do you ensure they also comply with the no-storage mandate?
What technical controls prevent accidental or intentional storage of transaction content by your personnel?
Do you utilize secure enclaves or memory scrubbing techniques to ensure transient data is irrecoverable after processing?

VEND-CORE-002.text: Do you provide a standard Data Processing Agreement (DPA) that meets GDPR Article 28 requirements, or do you negotiate custom DPAs?

Does your DPA explicitly address all Article 28(3) mandatory provisions: (a) processing instructions, (b) confidentiality, (c) security, (d) sub-processors, (e) data subject request assistance, (f) breach notification, (g) deletion/return, (h) audit rights?
How do you handle updates to the DPA when regulatory requirements change (e.g., new EDPB guidance)?
What is your process for approving and documenting the organization's specific processing instructions?
Are there any provisions in your standard DPA that limit the organization's audit rights beyond what GDPR permits?

VEND-CORE-003.text: Do you permit on-site audits of your facilities and systems by the organization or its designated auditors?
What third-party certifications or audit reports (e.g., SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001) do you provide to support compliance verification?
How frequently can the organization conduct audits, and what advance notice is required?
Are there any limitations on audit scope (e.g., shared infrastructure, sub-processor facilities, source code review)?
What is the cost structure for audits (e.g., included in contract, reasonable cost recovery, prohibited)?
How do you facilitate regulatory audits by supervisory authorities (e.g., DNB, ECB, national DPAs)?

VEND-CORE-004.text: Do you offer an automated Registration Management Interface to support the organization in completing, updating, and maintaining its registration as a Relying Party across all relevant Member States?
Do you support the full RP registration lifecycle, including initial onboarding, updates to intended uses, modification of requested data elements, certificate retrieval, and deregistration?
In which Member States can you facilitate and perform RP registrations? Can you support registrations in all Member States where the organization has legal entities?
Is the registration process automated end-to-end, or does it require manual steps? If manual, describe the manual touchpoints.
Is the registration process fully auditable? Can you provide registration history, change logs, and certificate issuance records?
How do you handle registration renewals and expiration notifications?
What is the typical turnaround time for new RP registrations and updates?
How do you handle discrepancies or rejections from national Registrars?

VEND-CORE-005.text: Do you obtain and manage Relying Party Access Certificates on behalf of the organization, or does the organization manage certificates directly?
How do you ensure certificates remain valid and are renewed before expiration?
What Access Certificate Authorities (ACAs) do you support for certificate issuance?
How are certificate private keys protected? Describe the key management infrastructure (e.g., HSM, cloud KMS, software keystore).
What monitoring and alerting is in place for certificate expiration, revocation, or compromise?
How do you handle emergency certificate revocation and replacement?
Can you support multiple certificates for different intended uses or Member States?
Does your lifecycle management process include automated key rotation for valid certificates?

VEND-CORE-006.text: Describe your encryption approach: what data is encrypted at rest and in transit, and what algorithms/key lengths are used?
What pseudonymization or anonymization techniques do you apply to wallet-related data?
How do you ensure the confidentiality, integrity, availability, and resilience of your processing systems?
What is your approach to regular security testing (e.g., penetration testing frequency, vulnerability scanning, red team exercises)?
Do you hold any security certifications (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, CSA STAR)? Provide certificate details and scope.
How do you assess and document the appropriateness of your security measures relative to the risk (as required by GDPR Article 32)?
What physical security controls are in place at your data centers or processing facilities?
How do you handle security updates and patching for your systems?

VEND-CORE-007.text: What is your committed timeframe for notifying the organization of a personal data breach after becoming aware of it?
What information do you provide in breach notifications (e.g., nature of breach, categories of data, affected individuals, remediation steps)?
How do you detect potential data breaches (e.g., SIEM, anomaly detection, intrusion detection systems)?
Do you have a documented incident response plan? Can the organization review this plan?
What is your escalation path for breach notification (e.g., 24/7 security operations center, dedicated contact)?
How do you assist the organization in meeting its 72-hour notification obligation to supervisory authorities under GDPR Article 33?
What post-incident support do you provide (e.g., forensic analysis, evidence preservation, root cause analysis)?

VEND-CORE-008.text: Are all personnel with access to wallet transaction data or systems contractually bound by confidentiality obligations?
What background checks or vetting procedures do you apply to personnel with data access?
How do you enforce the principle of least privilege for data access?
What security awareness training do personnel receive, and how frequently is it updated?
How are confidentiality obligations enforced for contractors, temporary staff, and sub-processor personnel?
What procedures are in place for revoking access when personnel leave or change roles?

VEND-CORE-009.text: How do you document and track the organization's processing instructions?
What technical and procedural controls prevent processing outside of documented instructions?
Do you process any wallet data for your own purposes (e.g., analytics, product improvement, marketing)? If so, describe what and under what legal basis.
Does your service involve any transfer of personal data to third countries or international organizations? If so, what safeguards are in place?
How do you notify the organization if you believe an instruction infringes GDPR or other data protection law?
How can the organization update or modify processing instructions, and what is the implementation timeframe?

VEND-CORE-010.text: What technical capabilities do you provide to assist the organization in responding to data subject access requests (DSARs)?
Can you search and retrieve all personal data relating to a specific data subject across your systems?
What is your committed response time for assisting with data subject requests?
How do you support data subject erasure requests (right to be forgotten) given the no-storage mandate?
Can you support data portability requests by providing data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format?
How do you handle requests for restriction of processing or objection to processing?
What audit trail do you maintain of data subject request handling for compliance verification?

VEND-CORE-011.text: How does your platform ensure that wallet users see both your identity (as intermediary) and the identity of the Relying Party on whose behalf you are acting?
What information about the Relying Party is displayed to the wallet user (e.g., legal name, logo, registration ID, intended use description)?
How do you handle scenarios where the Relying Party's information changes (e.g., name change, merger)?
Can wallet users easily distinguish between your identity and the Relying Party's identity in the consent flow?
How do you ensure the displayed Relying Party information is accurate and matches the registered data?

VEND-CORE-012.text: What is your process for notifying the organization if you receive a legal requirement (e.g., court order, law enforcement request) to process data beyond their instructions?
Do you notify the organization before complying with such requests, unless legally prohibited?
How do you document and track government or law enforcement data access requests?
Do you publish a transparency report on government access requests received and complied with?
In which jurisdictions are you subject to data access laws, and what is your policy on challenging overbroad requests?

VEND-CORE-013.text: Do you currently use sub-processors for any part of your EUDI Wallet intermediary service? If so, provide a complete list with their roles and locations.
What is your process for seeking authorization before adding or changing sub-processors?
Do you offer specific sub-processor authorization (per sub-processor) or general authorization with notification of changes?
What advance notice do you provide before engaging new sub-processors?
How do you ensure sub-processors comply with the same data protection obligations as you?
Do you remain fully liable for sub-processor compliance, or do you seek to limit liability?
Can the organization object to a proposed sub-processor change, and what happens if they do?

VEND-CORE-014.text: Given the no-storage mandate, what personal data might you hold at contract termination (e.g., configuration data, audit logs, registration data)?
What is your standard procedure for data return at contract termination? In what format is data returned?
What is your procedure for secure data deletion at contract termination? How is deletion verified?
Do you provide a deletion certificate or attestation upon completion of data deletion?
What is the timeframe for completing data deletion or return after contract termination?
Are there any circumstances where you are legally required to retain data beyond contract termination? If so, what data and for how long?
How do you ensure data in backups is also deleted within the required timeframe?

VEND-CORE-016.text: Do you perform the registration of intermediated Relying Parties at national Registrars, or does the organization do this directly?
Which Member State Registrars can you currently interface with for RP registration?
How do you handle registrations for Relying Parties established in Member States where you don't yet have Registrar integration?
Do you obtain registration certificates for each registered intended use on behalf of the Relying Party?
How do you manage updates to Relying Party registrations when their intended uses or requested data elements change?
What is your process for deregistering a Relying Party when they terminate their relationship with you?
How do you ensure compliance with each Member State's specific registration requirements and timelines?

VEND-CORE-017.text: What legal evidence do you submit to Registrars to prove the intermediary-Relying Party relationship (e.g., contract, power of attorney, letter of authorization)?
How do you ensure the legal evidence meets each Registrar's specific requirements?
What is your process for updating legal evidence when contracts are amended or renewed?
How do you handle Registrar rejections due to insufficient or invalid legal evidence?
Is the legal evidence submission process automated or manual?
How long do you retain copies of the legal evidence submitted to Registrars?

VEND-CORE-018.text: How do you verify the authenticity of PIDs and attestations received from wallet units?
Which wallet implementations have you tested verification compatibility with (EUDI reference, Apple, Google, third-party)?
How do you check the revocation status of presented credentials, and what revocation mechanisms do you support (Status Lists, OCSP, etc.)?
How do you verify device binding (proof that the credential is bound to the presenting wallet's secure element)?
How do you verify user binding (proof that the authorized user is presenting the credential)?
Do you support Zero-Knowledge Proof (ZKP) verification for privacy-preserving claims (e.g., age over 18)?
Can the organization configure which verification checks are performed for different use cases?
What happens if a verification check fails? How is this communicated to the user and logged for the organization?
Do you support Selective Disclosure (SD) to allow verification of specific attributes without revealing the full credential coverage?
Do you support batch verification of multiple credentials/presentations for high-volume use cases?

VEND-CORE-019.text: Do you support EUDI Wallet-based Strong Customer Authentication for payment transactions as specified in ARF Technical Specification 12 (TS12)?
How do you implement the two-factor authentication requirement (knowledge/possession/inherence) using the wallet's cryptographic mechanisms?
How do you achieve dynamic linking of authentication to specific transaction amount and payee as required by PSD2 RTS Article 5?
How do you ensure independence of authentication elements (that compromise of one element does not compromise others)?
What mechanisms are in place to detect and prevent fraud and transaction manipulation?
How do you support SCA exemptions (low-value payments, recurring transactions, trusted beneficiaries) while maintaining compliance?
What integration is required with the organization's existing payment infrastructure (PSP, acquirer, card schemes)?
Have you obtained or are you pursuing any PSD2 SCA certifications or attestations?
Do you support Delegated Authentication flows where the EUDI Wallet relies on an external authenticator (e.g., bank app)?If so, how is the trust model maintained?

VEND-CORE-020.text: Do you implement the OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance (OpenID4VCI) protocol as specified in ARF Technical Specification 6?
Which OpenID4VCI flows do you support (pre-authorized code, authorization code, deferred issuance)?
What credential formats do you support for issuance (SD-JWT-VC, mdoc/mDL, both)?
How do you handle wallet unit authentication during issuance (WUA verification, key binding)?
Do you support batch issuance of multiple credentials in a single session?
How do you handle credential refresh and re-issuance for expiring credentials?
Have you participated in any OpenID4VCI interoperability testing or certification programs?
How do you handle issuance failures and retries?
Do you support both same-device (issuance directly to wallet on same device) and cross-device (issuance via QR code/link to separate device) flows?

VEND-CORE-021.text: Do you implement the common data deletion request interface as specified in Technical Specification 7 (TS7)?
How do you authenticate users submitting deletion requests to ensure they are authorized to request deletion?
What is your response time for processing data deletion requests received via the TS7 interface?
How do you handle deletion requests when legal retention requirements apply?
Do you provide confirmation to the wallet user upon completion of the deletion?
How do you ensure deletion is propagated to all systems and backups?
What audit logging is maintained for deletion request processing?

VEND-CORE-022.text: Do you register attestation types in the EU catalogue of attributes and attestations as specified in Technical Specification 11?
What attestation types do you currently issue, and are they registered in the catalogue?
How do you ensure your attestation schemas comply with the common data model?
How do you handle schema versioning and updates?
Do you follow any sector-specific rulebooks for attestation structure (e.g., mobile driving license, payment credentials)?

VEND-CORE-023.text: Do you implement the open standards mapped in Technical Specification 1 (TS1) for EUDI Wallet interoperability?
Which specific standards do you implement (OpenID4VCI, OpenID4VP, SD-JWT, mdoc/mDL, ISO 18013-5, ISO 23220)?
Have you participated in EUDI Wallet plugfest or other interoperability testing events? What were the results?
Which wallet implementations have you tested interoperability with?
How do you track and adopt updates to these standards as they evolve?
Are there any proprietary extensions or deviations from the standard implementations? If so, describe them.
Given the evolving nature of EUDI standards, how do you manage breaking changes in draft specifications (e.g., OpenID4VCI drafts) to maintain backward compatibility?

VEND-CORE-024.text: Do you publish provider information endpoints as specified in Technical Specification 2 (TS2)?
What metadata do you publish (supported credential types, signing algorithms, trust chain, issuer identifiers)?
How frequently is your published metadata updated when your service configuration changes?
How do wallets and Relying Parties discover your published metadata?
Is your metadata endpoint highly available? What is the uptime SLA?

VEND-CORE-025.text: Do you verify the Wallet Unit Attestation (WUA) before issuing credentials as specified in Technical Specification 3?
What WUA verification checks do you perform (signature validation, certificate chain, revocation status, WSCD certification)?
How do you handle issuance requests from wallet instances with invalid, expired, or revoked WUAs?
How do you stay updated on the list of certified WSCDs and WUA trust anchors?
What is the latency impact of WUA verification on the issuance process?
How do you handle WUA verification failures? What feedback is provided to the wallet user?

VEND-CORE-026.text: Do you support remote qualified electronic signature creation via EUDI Wallet as specified in Technical Specification 8 (TS8)?
How do you ensure sole control of the signatory over the remote signing process?
What multi-factor authentication is required to authorize each signing operation?
Are signing keys generated and stored in HSMs meeting QSCD requirements?
How is the What You See Is What You Sign (WYSIWYS) principle implemented?
What document formats do you support for signing (PDF, XML, plain text)?
How do you support batch and automated signing scenarios while maintaining sole control?
Is your Server Signing Application (SSA) fully certified as part of a QSCD (Qualified Signature Creation Device)? Provide certification details.

VEND-CORE-027.text: Do you support pseudonym attestations as specified in Technical Specification 9 (TS9)?
Do you support User Pseudonyms (UP) for persistent pseudonymous relationships?
Do you support Wallet-RP Pseudonyms (WRP) for unlinkable transactions?
Do you support Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZKP) to prove attributes without revealing underlying data?
How do you ensure pseudonyms cannot be correlated across different Relying Parties or transactions?
Can pseudonymous users be re-identified if legally required (e.g., court order)? What is your process?

VEND-CORE-028.text: Do you provide data export capabilities as specified in Technical Specification 10 (TS10) for GDPR portability?
What data can be exported (transaction logs, credentials, presentation history)?
In what formats is data exported (JSON, XML, CSV)? Are these machine-readable and commonly used?
How do users request data export? Is it self-service or requires manual processing?
What is the response time for fulfilling data export requests?
How is exported data secured during transmission to the user?

VEND-CORE-029.text: How do you verify registration certificates presented by PID Providers, Attestation Providers, or other Relying Parties?
Do you validate certificate signatures against the Trusted List published by Member States?
How frequently do you update your local copy of Trusted Lists?
What happens when a counterparty presents an invalid or revoked registration certificate?
Do you support certificate verification for all Member States, or only specific ones?

VEND-CORE-030.text: How do you verify the cryptographic signature on attestations received from wallets?
How do you verify that attestations have not expired?
What revocation status checking mechanisms do you support for attestation validation?
How do you verify the issuer's access certificate chain?
What is the latency of your end-to-end attestation verification process?
How do you handle attestations from issuers not in your trust list?

VEND-CORE-031.text: Do you support registration of multiple intended uses for the organization?
How do you ensure the organization's intended uses remain aligned with the access certificate policies of each ACA?
What process is followed when an intended use needs to be added, modified, or removed?
How are access certificate policy updates from ACAs communicated and operationalized?
How do you handle revocation procedures required by access certificate policies?

VEND-CORE-032.text: How do you present the organization's RP Access Certificate to Wallet Units during presentation requests?
How do you ensure the presented certificate is current and not expired or revoked?
What information from the certificate is displayed to wallet users?
How do you handle certificate rotation or renewal without service interruption?
Do you support different certificates for different intended uses?

VEND-CORE-033.text: Do you correctly process pseudonym-based presentations when users choose to present them?
How do you validate that the pseudonym belongs to the presenting user?
What controls prevent your system from attempting to derive the user's true identity from a pseudonym?
How do you prevent correlation of pseudonyms across different transactions or sessions?
How do you verify registration/authentication with non-revoked Wallet Units for pseudonym presentations?
Do you maintain logs of pseudonym presentations? If so, how is this data protected?

VEND-CORE-034.text: Do you publish trust anchor information through the Access Certificate Authority notification process on behalf of the organization?
What information is included in the published trust anchor?
How do you handle updates to trust anchor information when organizational details change?
How quickly are trust anchor updates propagated to Wallet Units?
How do you handle trust anchor revocation if required?

VEND-CORE-035.text: What is your standard response time for processing GDPR Article 17 deletion requests?
How do you verify the identity of users submitting deletion requests?
How do you provide confirmation of deletion to the requesting user?
What valid grounds for refusal do you recognize, and how are these communicated?
How do you ensure all copies of the data, including backups, are deleted?
What audit trail is maintained for deletion request processing and completion?

VEND-CORE-038.text: Do you support the W3C Digital Credentials API for browser-mediated presentation requests?
Which browsers are supported for the Digital Credentials API flow?
How do you handle fallback for browsers that do not support the Digital Credentials API?
How is the credential exchange flow secured against man-in-the-middle attacks?
What user experience considerations have you implemented for the browser-mediated flow?

VEND-CORE-039.text: How does your system behave when revocation status information is temporarily unavailable?
Do you implement rate limiting to avoid repeatedly requesting unavailable status lists?
What fallback behavior is implemented when revocation checks cannot be completed?
How is the organization notified of revocation status unavailability events?
How long do you cache revocation status information, and what is your refresh strategy?

VEND-CORE-040.text: Do you support proximity identification flows (BLE/NFC) for local credential presentation?
If supported, which protocols do you implement (ISO/IEC 18013-5, BLE, NFC)?
What hardware is required at the Relying Party location for proximity flows?
How do proximity flows operate without internet connectivity?
What is the range and reliability of the proximity communication?
How is security maintained in the proximity flow (key exchange, encryption)?

VEND-CORE-041.text: How do you handle updates to the organization's registration certificates?
What is the process for certificate renewal before expiration?
How do you handle emergency certificate revocation situations?
How are updated certificates distributed to all systems that need them?
What notifications are sent for upcoming certificate expirations?
Is the certificate lifecycle fully automated or does it require manual intervention?

VEND-CORE-042.text: Does your platform apply GDPR-compliant data handling (encryption, access controls, audit logging) to ALL attestation processing by default?
Do you have separate processing paths that bypass security controls for 'non-personal data'? If so, describe them.
How do you handle attestations relating to legal persons or objects that may still be processed alongside personal data context?
What guidance do you provide to customers (RPs) regarding DPIA requirements for different attestation types?
How do you document exceptions for truly anonymous processing scenarios?
Do you implement 'Compliance by Environment' principles where session context (IP, wallet ID) is treated as personal data?

VEND-ICT-001.text: Does your standard contract include all mandatory provisions specified in DORA Article 30(2)?
How do you document service descriptions, processing locations, and data protection measures in contracts?
Do you have DORA-specific contract templates or amendments for financial entity customers?
How do you handle contract negotiations when the organization requires DORA-specific clauses?
Are processing locations documented and subject to approval by the financial entity?
Does your internal governance follow the 'three lines of defense' model (operations, risk management, internal audit)?

VEND-ICT-002.text: Do you grant full access, inspection, and audit rights to the financial entity and their supervisory authority?
What is the notice period required for audit requests?
Are on-site audits supported, or only remote/third-party audits?
How do you facilitate GDPR Article 28(3)(h) audit requirements in addition to DORA?
What audit reports or certifications can you provide proactively (SOC 2, ISO 27001)?
Are there any restrictions on audit scope or frequency?
Do you provide a 'Standard Audit Report' that specifically maps your internal controls to DORA Articles 28-30 requirements?

VEND-ICT-003.text: What transition period do you guarantee during contract termination?
What data migration assistance do you provide during exit?
Do you continue providing services during the transition to an alternative provider?
In what formats can data be exported for migration?
What is the cost model for exit support services?
Have you executed successful transitions for previous financial entity customers?

VEND-ICT-004.text: How do you cooperate with the organization's ICT risk management program?
Do you participate in the organization's risk assessments and control testing?
How do you support the organization's remediation activities?
What risk reporting do you provide to support the organization's risk framework?
Can the organization integrate your service into their risk monitoring tools?

VEND-ICT-005.text: What entity details do you provide for inclusion in the organization's ICT TPP register?
Do you provide criticality assessments for your services?
How do you notify the organization when register information changes?
What contractual terms summary do you provide for registry purposes?
How frequently do you update the information provided?

VEND-ICT-006.text: What financial stability information do you provide for due diligence?
How do you demonstrate ICT risk management capabilities?
What compliance posture evidence can you provide (certifications, audit reports)?
Do you have a standard due diligence package for financial entity prospects?
How do you respond to security questionnaire/RFI processes?
Can existing financial entity customers provide references?

VEND-ICT-007.text: What is your incident notification timeline (how quickly after detection)?
What channels are used for incident notification (email, phone, ticketing)?
Do you support integration with the organization's SIEM or security monitoring tools for automated alerting?
What information is included in incident notifications?
How do you support the organization's own regulatory incident reporting obligations?
Do you provide root cause analysis and remediation plans after incidents?
How do you classify 'Major ICT Incidents' under DORA, and do you support accelerated reporting (< 4 hours) for such events?

VEND-ICT-008.text: Do you support customer-initiated threat-led penetration testing (TLPT)?
What is the advance notice required for TLPT participation?
Are there scope limitations on penetration testing of your systems?
How do you handle remediation of vulnerabilities discovered during TLPT?
Do you conduct your own regular penetration testing?
Can TLPT results be shared with the organization's supervisory authority?
Do you support 'pooled auditing' or 'pooled TLPT' where multiple financial entities coordinate a single test to reduce operational burden?

VEND-ICT-009.text: What is your service availability SLA?
What disaster recovery capabilities do you maintain (RTO, RPO)?
How frequently are business continuity plans tested?
Do you provide business continuity test results to customers?
What was the outcome of your last disaster recovery test?
Do you conduct specific scenario-based testing (e.g., ransomware, physical destruction) beyond generic availability tests?

VEND-ICT-010.text: Do you use subcontractors for any part of the ICT service?
How do you obtain prior approval from the organization before engaging subcontractors?
How do you ensure subcontractors meet equivalent security and compliance requirements?
What visibility does the organization have into your subcontractor chain?
Can the organization reject specific subcontractors?
How are subcontractor changes communicated to the organization?

VEND-ICT-011.text: Can you disclose the approximate number of financial entities using your services?
What information do you provide on interdependencies with other ICT providers?
How do you support the organization's concentration risk analysis?
Do you have single points of failure that could affect multiple financial entities?
What is your geographic distribution of infrastructure?

VEND-ICT-012.text: Are you currently designated as a Critical ICT Third-Party Provider (CTPP) by the ESAs?
If designated, who is your Lead Overseer?
What additional oversight measures do you support for designated CTTPPs?
Do you anticipate designation as a CTPP in the future?
How would CTPP designation affect the organization's use of your services?

VEND-INT-001.text: How do you communicate both the intermediary's identity and the ultimate Relying Party's identity to the wallet for user display?
What data elements are included in the RP identity information (name, logo, registration status, intended use)?
How is the RP identity information kept current when RP details change?
How do you handle cases where the wallet does not display dual identities correctly?
Can the organization customize how their identity is presented to wallet users?
How does your solution render the 'on behalf of' relationship in the wallet authorization screen (e.g., utilizing client_metadata vs client_id_scheme)?

VEND-INT-002.text: What technical controls prevent the intermediary from modifying, expanding, or altering the RP's registered data request?
How do you validate that request forwarding only includes attributes registered by the RP?
Is there an audit trail showing the RP's original request versus what was sent to the wallet?
What happens if an RP attempts to request attributes not authorized in their registration?
How do you ensure alignment between registered intended uses and actual requests?

VEND-INT-003.text: How do you technically ensure requests are relayed to wallets without attribute modification?
Is the request payload signed or otherwise integrity-protected during relay?
What logging exists to demonstrate request forwarding integrity?
How is request integrity verified at the wallet end?

VEND-INT-004.text: How do you ensure wallet presentations are relayed to the RP without alteration, extraction, or processing?
What architectural controls prevent the intermediary from accessing or analyzing presentation content?
Is the presentation payload encrypted end-to-end from wallet to RP, with the intermediary unable to decrypt?
What audit evidence demonstrates that credential data is not accessed during transit?
How would a breach of this integrity control be detected?

VEND-INT-005.text: Do you support remote presentation via OpenID4VP as specified in ISO/IEC TS 18013-7?
Do you support proximity presentation via BLE/NFC as specified in ISO/IEC 18013-5?
Which wallet implementations have you tested protocol compatibility with (EUDI reference, Apple, Google, third-party)?
What hardware is required for proximity presentation support at the organization's locations?
Do you support SIOPv2 (Self-Issued OpenID Provider) as an alternative presentation protocol?
How do you handle mode switching when both remote and proximity are available?
Do you support both same-device (app-to-app) and cross-device (QR code) OID4VP presentation flows?
Do you support the `response_uri` method for receiving large presentation payloads asynchronous to the wallet interaction?

VEND-INT-006.text: How do you ensure attributes are forwarded ONLY to the specific RP on whose behalf the request was made?
What happens if verification failshow is it ensured no attributes are forwarded?
How do you prevent routing errors where data could be sent to the wrong RP?
What audit trail exists for successful and failed verification outcomes?

VEND-INT-007.text: How do you obtain and maintain Trusted Lists for PID Providers from Member States?
How frequently are Trusted Lists refreshed?
How do you handle additions, modifications, and revocations of trust anchors?
What is the latency between a trust anchor change and your system reflecting it?
Which Member States' Trusted Lists do you currently support?

VEND-INT-008.text: How do you maintain Trusted Lists for QEAA and EAA providers?
Do you distinguish between qualified and non-qualified attestation providers in your trust store?
How do you handle attestation providers not yet on Trusted Lists?
Can the organization configure additional trusted attestation providers beyond official lists?

VEND-INT-009.text: How do you ensure trust anchors are obtained exclusively from official EU and Member State sources?
Do you use any third-party aggregators for trust anchor data? If so, how is their authenticity verified?
What controls prevent injection of unauthorized trust anchors into your trust store?
How is the authenticity of Trusted List downloads verified (signatures, certificates)?

VEND-INT-010.text: How do you verify cryptographic signatures on attestations and PIDs?
What happens when a signature is invalidis the presentation rejected?
What happens when a signature is valid but the issuer is not in your trust store?
What cryptographic libraries do you use for signature verification?
How do you handle algorithm transitions as new algorithms are approved?

VEND-INT-011.text: Do you check attestation revocation status before accepting presentations?
What revocation checking mechanisms do you support (status lists, OCSP, token status)?
How do you handle revocation checking when status endpoints are unavailable?
What is the latency impact of revocation checking on verification time?
Can the organization configure whether revocation checking is mandatory or optional?
What caching strategies do you employ for Status Lists to minimize latency while ensuring freshness?

VEND-INT-012.text: How do you verify that presentations are cryptographically bound to the presenting wallet's WSCD?
What proof-of-possession mechanisms do you verify (device key signatures, key attestations)?
How do you detect presentations that may have been exported from the original device?
What is the failure handling when device binding verification fails?

VEND-INT-013.text: How do you verify that presentations are fresh and not replayed from previous sessions?
What nonce or challenge mechanisms do you use?
How do you handle timestamp verification for presentation freshness?
What is the time window for accepting presentations (tolerance for clock skew)?
How do you detect and block replay attempts?
How do you bind the wallet response to the specific browser session or client state initiating the request (e.g., state param handling)?

VEND-INT-014.text: What transport layer security do you use for transmitting presentations to the RP (TLS version, cipher suites)?
Do you support mutual TLS (mTLS) for RP authentication?
How are RP endpoints authenticated before forwarding data?
What happens if the secure channel to the RP cannot be established?
Is application-layer encryption used in addition to transport encryption?

VEND-INT-016.text: How do you securely store cryptographic material used in verification operations?
Are verification keys stored in HSMs or equivalent secure storage?
What access controls govern key usage?
How do you prevent unauthorized access, modification, or extraction of keys?
What is your key rotation and lifecycle management process?

VEND-INT-017.text: How do you protect verification results from tampering before they reach the RP?
Are verification results signed or otherwise integrity-protected?
How can the RP verify that the verification outcome is authentic and unmodified?
What audit trail exists for verification decisions?

VEND-INT-018.text: What verification operations are logged (timestamps, outcomes, error codes)?
How do you ensure logs do not contain attestation content (per no-storage mandate)?
How long are verification logs retained?
Can logs be exported for dispute resolution or compliance audits?
How are logs protected against tampering?

VEND-INT-019.text: What technical controls prevent extraction of individual attribute values from presentations?
Are presentations treated as opaque payloads that cannot be decoded by the intermediary?
How would attribute extraction be detected if it occurred?
Do you undergo third-party audits to verify no-extraction compliance?

VEND-INT-020.text: What technical and architectural controls prevent correlation of wallet user activity across different RPs?
Are RP relationships logically isolated to prevent cross-linking?
What data isolation exists between different RP tenants in your platform?
How would unauthorized correlation be detected?
Do you undergo privacy audits verifying unlinkability?

VEND-INT-021.text: How do you ensure complete deletion of PIDs, attestations, and user attributes immediately after forwarding to the RP?
What is the definition of 'immediately'what is the maximum time window?
How is deletion verified (not just marked for deletion, but actually purged)?
How do you handle deletion when forwarding fails?
Does deletion extend to all copies including memory, caches, and logs?
What audit evidence demonstrates compliance with immediate deletion?

VEND-INT-022.text: What RP details do you include in presentation requests (user-friendly name, unique ID, Registrar URL, intended use)?
How do you obtain and maintain RP details for each intermediated RP?
What happens when RP registration details changehow quickly is the update reflected?
Can the organization customize the user-friendly name and description shown to users?

VEND-INT-023.text: Do you support SD-JWT-VC format for remote presentations?
Do you support ISO 18013-5 mDoc format for proximity presentations?
If both remote and proximity modes are supported, are both formats fully implemented?
Which wallet implementations have you tested format compatibility with (EUDI reference, Apple, Google, third-party)?
Have you participated in EUDI Wallet plugfest or interoperability testing events?
For SD-JWT-VC, do you support verification of individual disclosures (claims) independent of the full payload?

VEND-INT-024.text: Does your verification implementation correctly handle selectively disclosed attributes?
Do you support partial attribute disclosure in both mDoc and SD-JWT-VC formats?
How do you verify presentations where only a subset of attributes is disclosed?
What happens if an RP requests an attribute that was not disclosed?

VEND-INT-025.text: Do you have certifications for your cryptographic implementations (FIPS 140-2/3, Common Criteria)?
What certified cryptographic libraries or modules do you use?
If not currently certified, is certification on your roadmap?
Can you provide certification evidence to the organization for their risk assessment?

VEND-INT-026.text: How do you verify RP compliance with embedded disclosure policies in attestations?
What happens when an RP does not meet the disclosure policy conditions?
How is the disclosure policy verification result communicated to the wallet for user display?
What disclosure policy types do you support?

VEND-INT-027.text: Do you support WebAuthn-based pseudonymous authentication from wallet units?
Which WebAuthn attestation and assertion modes do you support?
How do you handle pseudonymous authentication without revealing user identity?
What WebAuthn authenticator types are supported?

VEND-INT-028.text: Do you correctly handle RP-specific pseudonyms generated by wallets?
How do you ensure pseudonyms cannot be linked across different RPs using your service?
What technical controls prevent pseudonym correlation?
Do you maintain any mapping between pseudonyms and real identities?

VEND-INT-029.text: How do you obtain and manage Wallet-Relying Party Access Certificates from Registrars?
How do you ensure the certificate is valid and not expired when interacting with wallets?
What certificate lifecycle management is in place (renewal alerts, automated rotation)?
How do wallets verify your access certificate?
What happens if the access certificate is revoked or expires during operations?

VEND-INT-030.text: Do you implement the common data deletion request interface as specified in TS7?
How do you authenticate users submitting deletion requests via the TS7 interface?
Given the no-storage mandate, what data is subject to deletion requests?
What is your response time for processing deletion requests?
How do you relay deletion requests to the ultimate RP when needed?
Is the deletion request automatically routed to the backend RP systems via webhook/API, or is it a manual notification?

VEND-INT-031.text: How is your identity (as intermediary) presented to users and potentially included in DPA reports?
What contact information is provided to users for complaint purposes?
How do you support investigation requests from data protection authorities?
What process is in place to respond to DPA inquiries about intermediation activities?

VEND-INT-032.text: Do you include both your access certificate and the intermediated RP's registration certificate in wallet requests?
How do you obtain and maintain RP registration certificates?
What happens when an RP does not have a registration certificate?
How are certificate updates reflected in ongoing operations?

VEND-INT-033.text: How do you ensure the intermediary-RP relationship is registered with the Registrar before beginning operations?
What legal evidence do you provide to Registrars to establish the relationship?
How do you handle wallets that cannot verify the registered relationship?
What is the timeline from contract signing to registered relationship?
How do you manage relationship updates (new RPs, terminated RPs)?

VEND-INT-034.text: Do you support attestation status list verification as specified in ARF Topic 7?
What status list formats do you support (Attestation Status List, Token Status List)?
How frequently do you refresh status lists from issuers?
What is the fallback behavior when status lists are unavailable?
Can the organization configure revocation checking behavior (mandatory vs. optional)?

VEND-ISS-001.text: Do you provide tooling or services to register the organization as an Attestation Provider with Member State authorities?
Which Member States do you currently support for Attestation Provider registration?
What documentation and prerequisites must the organization provide for registration?
What is the typical timeline from application to inclusion in Trusted Lists?
How do you track and alert on registration status and renewal requirements?
Do you manage ongoing compliance with registration conditions on behalf of the organization?

VEND-ISS-002.text: Do you publish machine-readable Provider Information according to the data model in Annex I of Regulation 2024/2981?
What metadata do you publish (supported attestation types, issuance policies, data sources, endpoints)?
How is the Provider Information discovered by wallets and Relying Parties?
Is the Provider Information endpoint highly available? What is the uptime SLA?
How do you validate that published information conforms to the required schema?

VEND-ISS-003.text: How do you ensure Provider Information is updated within 24 hours when operational changes occur?
Is the update process automated when configuration changes are made, or does it require manual intervention?
What audit trail exists for Provider Information updates?
How are organizations alerted when an update is required but has not yet been published?

VEND-ISS-004.text: Do you support the organization's application for QTSP status and Trusted List inclusion?
Which Member States' Trusted Lists can you support for inclusion?
What assistance do you provide for the conformity assessment audit required for QTSP status?
How do you monitor Trusted List status and alert on any changes affecting the organization?
What is your experience with QTSP certification timelines in different Member States?

VEND-ISS-005.text: Do you support issuing attestations in BOTH ISO 18013-5 (mDoc) and SD-JWT-VC formats simultaneously?
When a wallet requests issuance, do you automatically issue in all mandated formats, or must each format be requested separately?
How do you ensure format paritythat both mDoc and SD-JWT-VC contain identical attribute data?
Do you publish supported formats in Provider Information per ARF ISSU_12a?
Which wallet implementations have you tested format compatibility with (e.g., EUDI reference wallet, Apple, Google, third-party)?
Have you participated in EUDI Wallet plugfest or interoperability testing events?
What is the measured latency overhead of generating both mDoc and SD-JWT-VC formats simultaneously compared to a single format?

VEND-ISS-006.text: How do you cryptographically bind issued attestations to the Wallet Unit's secure cryptographic device (WSCD)?
What proof-of-possession mechanism do you use during issuance to verify key ownership?
Do you support both single-attestation keys and wallet-wide device keys for binding?
How is device binding verified during the issuance flow before the attestation is issued?
Do you support key import (Bring Your Own Key) for device binding keys, or must keys be generated within your platform?
Can your issuance pipeline distinguish between keys bound to a Secure Element (SE) versus a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) for LoA enforcement?

VEND-ISS-007.text: Do you fully implement the OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance (OpenID4VCI) protocol as specified in ARF Technical Specification 6?
Which OpenID4VCI grant types do you support (pre-authorized code flow, authorization code flow)?
Do you support deferred credential issuance for asynchronous processing?
What credential offer mechanisms do you support (QR codes, deep links, pushed authorization requests)?
Which wallet implementations have you tested OpenID4VCI compatibility with?
How do you handle issuance errors, retries, and partial failures?
Do you support the OID4VCI Batch Issuance Endpoint capability to reduce round-trips for multiple credential issuance?

VEND-ISS-008.text: Do you support batch issuance of multiple attestations in a single session?
Is batch issuance processed synchronously or asynchronously?
Do you offer a bulk upload interface (CSV, JSON) for high-volume batch issuance?
What is the maximum batch size you have tested in production?
How are failures handled in batch issuancedoes one failure abort the batch or continue with remaining?
Can different attestation types be combined in a single batch issuance?
What is your sustained throughput (credentials/second) for batch issuance jobs in a production environment?

VEND-ISS-009.text: What identity verification methods do you support (video identification, national eID, in-person verification)?
What levels of assurance (LoA) can you achieve for identity proofing (Low, Substantial, High)?
Do you support identity verification using an existing PID in the wallet, in addition to independent proofing?
Do you support FIDO2/WebAuthn for authentication during identity verification flows?
How do you verify the identity of legal persons (organizations) requesting attestations?
What audit trail is maintained for identity verification decisions?

VEND-ISS-010.text: Which authentic sources do you connect to for attestation data (national registries, authoritative databases)?
Do you support authentic sources in multiple EU Member States?
Do you use mutual TLS (mTLS) or equivalent secure channels when connecting to authentic sources?
Do you maintain cryptographic audit trails linking attestations to source queries?
How do you handle source unavailability or data freshness issues?
Can the organization integrate additional authentic sources through your platform?

VEND-ISS-011.text: Do you include clearly defined validity periods (valid_from, valid_until) in all issued attestations?
How are validity periods determined for different attestation types?
Can the organization configure attestation validity periods, or are they fixed?
How do you handle clock synchronization to ensure accurate issuance timestamps?
Do you notify users when their attestations are approaching expiry?

VEND-ISS-012.text: Do you support workflows for renewing attestations before expiry?
Can attestations be re-issued when the underlying data changes (e.g., address change)?
How do users receive notifications of upcoming expiry?
Is renewal automated, or does it require user action?
When an attestation is renewed, is the old attestation automatically revoked?
What is the lead time for renewal notifications?

VEND-ISS-013.text: Do you maintain and publish attestation status lists for revocation checking?
What status list formats do you support (Token Status List, Attestation Status List)?
How frequently are status lists updated?
Is status list publication highly available? What is the uptime SLA?
How do Relying Parties discover and access your status list endpoints?
Do you support privacy-preserving status checks (e.g., using signed status assertions)?

VEND-ISS-014.text: What is the maximum propagation time for standard attestation revocations?
Do you support immediate revocation for critical security situations?
How is revocation propagation time measured and audited?
What caching strategy is used for status lists, and how does this affect effective revocation time?
How do you handle revocation during status list endpoint outages?

VEND-ISS-015.text: Do you notify users when their attestations are revoked?
Through what channels are revocation notifications sent (push notification, email, in-app)?
How quickly are notifications sent after revocation occurs?
Does the notification include the reason for revocation and guidance for resolution?
How do you handle notification delivery failures?

VEND-ISS-016.text: Do you support temporary suspension of attestations (as distinct from permanent revocation)?
What triggers can initiate attestation suspension (fraud investigation, user request, authority order)?
Can suspended attestations be reinstated? What is the process?
How is suspension status reflected in the status lists?
Are users notified when their attestations are suspended and when reinstated?

VEND-ISS-017.text: Are attestation signing keys stored and used within Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) or equivalent secure cryptographic devices?
What certification level do your cryptographic modules have (FIPS 140-2/3 Level 3, Common Criteria EAL4+)?
Do you support Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for organizations that want to manage their own signing keys?
Do you require multi-person approval (quorum/four-eye principle) for sensitive key operations?
Do you offer cloud-hosted HSM or require on-premises HSM deployment?
How are HSM backup and disaster recovery handled without exposing keys?

VEND-ISS-018.text: Which signing algorithms do you support from the approved list (ECDSA P-256, EdDSA Ed25519, RSA-PSS)?
How do you ensure only approved algorithms are used for attestation signing?
Do you support algorithm agility to transition when new algorithms are approved or deprecated?
Is Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) on your roadmap? Which algorithms are you evaluating?
How do you handle cross-format algorithm compatibility (mDoc vs. SD-JWT-VC)?
Can your signing service abstract away the underlying HSM specifics (e.g., support both Luna and nCipher via a unified API)?

VEND-ISS-019.text: Do you have documented key rotation procedures?
How do you transition to new signing keys while maintaining validity of previously issued attestations?
What is the recommended key rotation frequency?
How is key rotation communicated to Trusted Lists and verifiers?
What happens to attestations signed with retired keysdo they remain valid until expiry?
Is key rotation automated or does it require manual intervention?

VEND-ISS-020.text: Do you support registration of attestation types in the Common Catalogue of Attestation Types per TS11?
What information is published to the catalogue for each attestation type?
How do wallets and RPs discover attestation types through the catalogue?
How do you handle updates to catalogue entries when attestation types change?
Is catalogue registration automated as part of attestation type deployment?

VEND-ISS-021.text: Do you document and publish schemas for each attestation type?

How do you handle schema versioning and backwards compatibility?
Are schemas published in machine-readable formats for automated validation?
Do schemas include semantic definitions for each attribute?

VEND-ISS-022.text: How do you ensure attestations contain only attributes necessary for their intended purpose?

Do you offer guidance on data minimization during attestation type design?
How do you handle requests to include unnecessary attributes in attestations?

VEND-ISS-023.text: How do you ensure attestations do not contain overt or hidden tracking identifiers?

Can the attestation structure be audited for privacy compliance by independent parties?

VEND-ISS-024.text: Are attestations issued through your platform verifiable and recognizable in all EU Member States?

How do you handle Member State-specific attribute requirements or namespaces?
What languages are supported for attestation attribute labels and values?

VEND-ISS-026.text: Do you support Person Identification Data (PID) issuance compliant with the PID Rulebook?

How do you handle CBOR encoding for mDoc format attributes?

VEND-ISS-027.text: Do you offer attestations in all formats required by the applicable Rulebook?

VEND-ISS-028.text: Do you implement attestation revocation as specified in the applicable Rulebook?

VEND-ISS-029.text: How do you ensure registration information remains accurate in Member State registries?

VEND-ISS-030.text: Do you publish trust anchor information according to the Commission's common format?

VEND-ISS-031.text: Do you verify the Wallet Unit Attestation (WUA) before issuing PIDs or device-bound attestations?

VEND-ISS-032.text: Do you support embedding disclosure policies in issued attestations?

VEND-ISS-034.text: Do you issue PIDs in SD-JWT VC format compliant with ARF specifications?

VEND-TSP-002.text: When was your last conformity assessment, and who conducted it?

VEND-TSP-003.text: What process do you have for notifying your supervisory body of significant changes?

VEND-TSP-005.text: What measures protect electronic signature creation data (private keys) from duplication?

VEND-TSP-006.text: What is your Recovery Time Objective (RTO) for trust services?

VEND-TSP-007.text: What is your process for detecting and classifying security breaches?

VEND-TSP-008.text: Do you offer remote qualified electronic signature services?

VEND-TSP-009.text: How do you ensure the signatory has sole control over the signature creation process?
